fullDescription.text:
In the function `collectPercentOfFees(uint256)` a non-zero amount of Ether is sent to an address taken from storage slot 5.
There is a check on storage index 5. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `DynamicPyramid()`.

There is a check on storage index 5. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `DynamicPyramid()`.
There is a check on storage index 1. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `fallback`.
A possible transaction order independence vulnerability exists in function collectPercentOfFees(uint256). The value or direction of the call statement is determined from a tainted storage location
The return value of an external call is not checked. Note that execution continue even if the called contract throws.

A reachable exception (opcode 0xfe) has been detected. This can be caused by type errors, division by zero, out-of-bounds array access, or assert violations. This is acceptable in most situations. Note however that `assert()` should only be used to check invariants. Use `require()` for regular input checking.

A possible integer overflow exists in the function `collectFeesInEther(uint256)`.
The addition or multiplication may result in a value higher than the maximum representable integer.

Multiple sends exist in one transaction, try to isolate each external call into its own transaction. As external calls can fail accidentally or deliberately.
Consecutive calls: 
Call at address: 3420

Rubixi.addPayout has external calls inside a loop:
	- participants[payoutOrder].etherAddress.send(payoutToSend) (/data/demo_analysis/source_code/rubixi.sol#74)
